def: An obligation by which property of a debtor was made over tohis creditor in security of his debt.
The quality or state of being wavy.
One of two corresponding copies of an instrument; a duplicate.
A public shed, or portico, for travelers, worshipers, etc.[Burmah]
A black or greenish black mineral occurring in foliated flates,also in velvety bronze-colored incrustations. It is a hydroussilicate of iron and alumina.
Of or pertaining to tungsten; containing tungsten; as,tungstenic ores. [R.]
One who has an equal portion with others of an inheritance.All the coparceners together make but one heir, and have but oneestate among them. blackstone.
, v. t. [imp. & p. p. Feoffed; p. pr. & vb. n.. Feoffing.]Etym: [OE. feffen, OF. feffer, fieffer, F. fieffer, fr. fief fief;cf. LL. feoffare, fefare. See Fief.] (Law)
